refnamediv.refpurpose: find optimum parameter settings for bogofilter

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Bogotune determines optimum parameter settings for bogofilter. To run it requires a set of spam messages and a set of non-spam messages. It can be run using the production wordlist or, with large message sets it is able to build a wordlist using half of the messages. The training database should have been built from at least 1,000 spam and 1,000 nonspam messages, and the ratio of spam to nonspam should be in the range 0.2 to 5. There should be at least 1,000 spam messages and 1,000 nonspam in the message files. Message files may be in mbox, maildir, or MH folder or any combination. Msg-count files can also be used, but not mixed with other formats.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The -h option prints the help message and exits.
The -v option increases the verbosity level. Level 1 displays the scan output in detail instead of using a progress meter.
The -c filename option tells bogofilter to read the config file named.
The -C option prevents bogotune from reading a configuration file.
The -d dir option specifies the directory for the database. See the ENVIRONMENT section for other directory setting options.
The -D option tells bogotune to build a wordlist in memory from half the input messages.
The -n option tells bogotune that the following arguments are files (or folders) containing non-spam.
The -s option tells bogotune that the following arguments are files (or folders) containing spam.

refsect1.title: ENVIRONMENT
refsect1.para: Bogofilter uses a database directory, which can be set in the config file. If not set there, bogofilter will use the value of BOGOFILTER_DIR. Both can be overridden by the -ddir option. If none of that is available, bogofilter will use directory $HOME/.bogofilter.

refsect1.title: Bugs
refsect1.para: Bogotune is not particularly robust when presented with garbage input.
